title: Oxfordshire Way Walking Route

images.title: Shaun Ferguson / Oxfordshire Way
images.caption: Heading for the Menmarsh Guide Post.

images.title: Jonathan Billinger / The Oxfordshire Way
images.caption: Looking west from near Wyck Beacon over the Windrush Valley and Bourton-on-the-Water.

images.title: Graham Horn / Oxfordshire Way
images.caption: Here the path goes down the Chilterns western scarp face onto the Oxfordshire plain.

images.title: don cload / Autumn on the Oxfordshire Way
images.caption: Autumn on the Oxfordshire Way near Henley

images.title: Dennis Turner / Middle Assenden village
images.caption: Middle Assenden village. View of this Chilterns village from the Oxfordshire Way.

images.title: SA Mathieson / Edge of Greenhill Copse
images.caption: Edge of Greenhill Copse. This small, dense area of woodland is close to the Evenlode river, and passed by part of the trail.

images.title: Philip Halling / Bruern Abbey
images.caption: Bruern Abbey viewed from the Oxfordshire Way. One of the pleasures of walking is discovering the unexpected such as this imposing Georgian house which today is home to a boarding school for boys aged 7-13 with dyslexia or other specific learning difficulties. The house was built on the site of a Cistercian Abbey, founded in 1147. In 1947, the house was bought by Michael Aster, third son of Waldorf, 2nd Viscount Astor and his wife American born Nancy.

images.title: Philip Halling / Bridge over a stream, Salmonsbury Meadows
images.caption: Bridge over a stream, Salmonsbury Meadows. On route from Bourton-on-the-Water to Wyck Rissington the trail crosses this bridge.

description: Take a trip through Oxfordshire and enjoy rivers, canals, pretty villages and beautiful countryside on this lovely trail. The walk starts in Bourton on the Water in the Cotswolds and passes Shipton-under-Wychwood, Otmoor RSPB Nature Reserve, Shipton Under Wychwood, Wychwood Forest, Cornbury Park and Charlbury .
